page.title: 01AROUND BUCHANAN
page.content: The main{landscape}of our area is moorland but there is some coniferous planted areas. The moorland covers all of Moorpark and is populated with black grouse,pheasant,capercailzie, green woodpecker,ptarmigan,moorhen, crow,blackbird,ravens,kestral, sparrowhawk,buzzards,collared _ dove, wood pigeon,bluetit,robin, chaffinch,bullfinch,fox,badger,shrew, deer,mole,vole,otter,grass _ snake, rabbit,adder,hares,mice,squirels, domesticated sheep and cattle and wild cats. Collies are kept by farmers as sheep dogs and the locals keep cats and dogs as pets. In Milton we have a school,village hall,church,mill and boatyard. There is also{St.Maha's well whose water heals when drunk. There is also a youth club which began in March 1985. Sometimes we go canoeing.
